definition: to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

sentences.english: It is essential that we speak out loud and clear against such abuses.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須站出來大聲疾呼，反對這種惡行。

sentences.english: I am grateful to Bob Mundell who, too, has spoken out loud on many occasions against significant appreciation of the RMB.
sentences.chinese: 感謝蒙代爾，他也曾多次大聲疾呼地反對人民幣升值。

sentences.english: Finally, we call for the rebuilding of the soul of learning and seek out the reverted road of the soul.
sentences.chinese: 論文最後，大聲疾呼要重建學魂並探求學魂復歸之路。

sentences.english: He was speaking out, he said because the Turks are the ethnic brothers of the Turkic Muslim Uigur .
sentences.chinese: 他大聲疾呼是因爲土耳其是維吾爾穆斯林的宗教盟友。

sentences.english: The demonstrators were baying for the resignation of the prime minister.
sentences.chinese: 遊行示威者大聲疾呼，要求首相辭職。

sentences.english: The newspapers clamoured against the government's policy.
sentences.chinese: 報紙大聲疾呼反對政府的政策。

sentences.english: That is the biggest problem that is crying out, " noted Aiyar."
sentences.chinese: 這是正在大聲疾呼的最大問題。

definition: to be reluctant to give up a post
to deliver/to send a letter/a letter (of complaint, opinion etc)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to stake all on one throw
to regard it as an honor (idiom)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
